answers.author: Hannah Wolford
answers.text:
ICMA's Center for Performance Measurement collects this type of information from our participants across the United States.  Ninety-four participants reported their road rehabilitation expenditures per paved lane mile with an average of $3,867 and a median of $2,894.  Eighty-six participants reported street sweeping expenditures per mile swept with an average of $47 and a median of $36.  In our Highways & Roads template, we also collect information on
-Road reconstruction expenditures per paved lane mile
-Expenditures per traffic signal repair & per traffic signal replacement
-Expenditures per pavement patch
Please visit our website www.icma.org/performance for more information or you may purchase our data report at https://store.brightdoc.com/store/default.asp?clientid=218

author: Kimble Corbridge
text:
This is my first time using the question tool, so I hope it makes sense.
I am looking for cost per mile (etc) averages for all road maintenance activites.  For example cost per mile of paving, cost for mile of street sweeping, cost per foot of crack sealing, cost per mile of road side drainage maintenance, cost per traffic sign maintenance and others.
Are any of these costs tracked on a national basis?
title: national averages for road maintenance activities
